channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Massive pot hole by bollards at station approach Elmers End, 23rd January
item.description:
This pot hole has been growing over the last couple of weeks and is now very large. Cars swerve to avoid going into it but if there is traffic in front of you and you don’t know it is there you drive into a deep hole.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St. Margaret's Road, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Station Rise SE27 9BW outside number 12 (Xquisite, 23rd January
item.description:
Station Rise SE27 9BW outside number 12 (Xquisite restaurant) is a Lambeth pink powder coated painted metal cycle parking ‘rail’ has been graffiti tagged – Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor for reporting pin &, picture. (I hope your contractor does not make a ‘meal of this’ like they did back in 2025 – ie Lambeth ref: Your ref: 445781 and my report: https://www.fixmystreet.com/report/8011571 and to be clear not having any pink paint is not a reason for no action.)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8A, Station Rise, Tulse Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poo outside garages, 23rd January
item.description:
Dog walkers letting their dogs foul outside residents garage and leaving it there. I have recently reported this and was told fixed. When I went to check it was still there.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barfreston Way, Anerley, Greater London

item.title: This must be 60cm long, 40cm wide and over 25 cm deep. As you drive toward Chislehurst lakes just passed sturgess field on Ashfield lane, 23rd January
item.description:
This has been reported before. Several times. It’s dangerous and will cause a crash. You don’t see it until right on top of it. If someone is going toward sidcup you have no option but to drive over this ….well fall into it I recently had my suspension replaced and this this caused an almighty bang. I will be seeing if there is damage to my car Insane this has t at least been cordoned off

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ashfield Lane, Chislehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car idling next to nursery, 23rd January
item.description:
Today I went to pick up my children from nursery. When I arrived there was a car parked right outside the fence with the engine running. The kids were playing outside so my children were basically 2 meters away from the exhaust. I politely asked the driver to switch off his engine but he refused to do so, used profane expletives, and tried to intimidate me.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Saint Mary's Square, Paddington, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Headcorn Road, Sundridge, Greater London

item.title: Bus stop E Blackheath Station towards Lee Green Or Lewisham : all timetables gone missing in last couple of days, 23rd January
item.description:
Bus stop E Blackheath Station towards Lee Green Or Lewisham : all timetables gone missing in last couple of days See photos &&& In addition the right hand display case door is warped and was poorly secured for some time before this Needs replacements for 54 89 108 202 N89 & SL4 Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bennett Park, Kidbrooke, Greater London

item.title: The foot way has been blocked off on the east side of Deepdene Road around number 28 Bellegrove Road. This is fairway high wooden boarding with no signs or provisions for pedestrians. item.description:

item.title: Potholes, 23rd January
item.description:
A number of potholes located on Monkfrith way, just north of friar's walk on BOTH carriageways. A couple have been filled recently but MANY more remain..why weren't these filled too?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brunswick Park, Greater London

item.title: Paving slabs sticking up and many broken., 23rd January
item.description:
This is a problem that has been noticeable for a long time. There is a whole stretch of bad paving on Radbourne Road running along the side of Telferscot School. I have noticed it because it is the area from my house that leads to the bus stop. Whilst the paving on the Hyde Farm Estate area is generally not good ( adjacent Wandsworth has replaced many of their streets locally with new paving), this particular area seems especially bad and in my opinion presents a significant trip hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Telferscot Road, Streatham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
